title: Gini Coefficient
nameOfSource: World Bank, Poverty and Inequality Platform
owidProcessingLevel: Processed by Our World in Data
subtitle: Inequality, as measured by the Gini coefficient – a measure that ranges between 0 and 1, where higher values indicate higher inequality. Depending on the country and year, the data relates to either disposable income or consumption per capita.

datasetFeaturedVariables.variableName: Share of population living on less than $30 a day
datasetFeaturedVariables.variableSubtitle: The share of population living below $30 per day. This data is adjusted for inflation and for differences in the cost of living between countries.

datasetFeaturedVariables.variableName: Poverty gap index at $2.15 a day
datasetFeaturedVariables.variableSubtitle: A measure that reflects both the prevalence and the depth of poverty, as measured by the International Poverty Line of $2.15 per day. It is calculated as the mean shortfall from the poverty line counting the non-poor as having zero shortfall, and expressed as a percentage of the poverty line.

datasetFeaturedVariables.variableName: Share of income or consumption received by the richest 10%
datasetFeaturedVariables.variableSubtitle: The income or consumption received by the richest 10% of households, as a share of the total.

datasetFeaturedVariables.variableName: Median income or consumption per day
datasetFeaturedVariables.variableSubtitle: Mean income or consumption per day. This data is adjusted for inflation and for differences in the cost of living between countries.
